author: Special Correspondent
text:
Devotees of all ages performed the ‘fire walk’ ritual at Bannari Amman Temple in Erode.- Photo: M. Govarthan

Over two lakh devotees offered prayers at the Bannari Amman Temple during the intervening night of Monday-Tuesday and several thousands among them performed ‘fire walk’ ritual as part of the annual kundam festival that began on March 7.

Processions

Procession of deity in villages, daily special pujas and traditional dance by local tribal communities preceded the main ‘fire walk’ ritual. Devotees from various parts of Tamil Nadu and also Karnataka took part in the festival.

Devotees offered wood, turmeric, garlic, tobacco, salt, pepper to propitiate the deity. Some even offered country chicken.

A good number of devotees had their heads tonsured.

State Environment Minister Thoppu N.D. Venkatachalam, Tirupur MP V. Sathyabama, and Labour Commissioner Amutha were among the important dignitaries who performed the fire-walking ritual.

As many as 1,800 police personnel were posted for security duty under the supervision of Superintendent of Police M.R. Sibi Chakravarthy.
title: Over two lakh devotees throng Bannari for kundam festival
